id.description: (STIX v2.0 required common property) A unique identifier for the attack pattern.

type.description: (STIX v2.0 required) The type of object, 'attach-pattern' is type 'bundle'

spec_version.description: The version of the STIX specification used to represent the content in this Bundle.

id.description: A unique identifier for the attack pattern.

name.description: (STIX v2.0 required) A string identifying the attack pattern.

created.description: (STIX v2.0 optional common property) The date and time the intrusion set was first created.

created_by_ref.description: (STIX v2.0 optional common property) specifies the ID of the Identity object that describes the entity that created this object.the intrusion set was created.

modified.description: (STIX v2.0 optional common property) The date and time this version of the intrusion set was created.

revoked.description: (STIX v2.0 optional common property) Whether the object has been revoked.

labels.description: (STIX v2.0 optional common property) specifies a set of classifications.

x_mitre_detection.description: Strategies for identifying if a technique has been used by an adversary.

x_mitre_platforms.description: List of platforms that apply to the technique.

x_mitre_data_sources.description: Sources of information that may be used to identify the action or result of the action being performed.

x_mitre_is_subtechnique.description: If true, this attack-pattern is a sub-technique

x_mitre_system_requirements.description: Additional information on requirements the adversary needs to meet or about the state of the system (software, patch level, etc.) that may be required for the technique to work.

x_mitre_permissions_required.description: The lowest level of permissions the adversary is required to be operating within to perform the technique on a system.

x_mitre_effective_permissions.description: The level of permissions the adversary will attain by performing the technique.

x_mitre_defense_bypassed.description: List of defensive tools, methodologies, or processes the technique can bypass

x_mitre_remote_support.description: If true, the technique can be used to execute something on a remote system.

x_mitre_impact_type.description: Denotes if the technique can be used for integrity or availability attacks.

x_mitre_domains.description: The domains the object is found in.

x_mitre_modified_by_ref.description: The identity of the individual or organization which created the current version of the object.

x_mitre_attack_spec_version.description: This field tracks the version of the ATT&CK Spec used by the object.

x_mitre_version.description: The version of the object in format major.minor

x_mitre_contributors.description: People and organizations who have contributed to the object.

x_mitre_deprecated.description: Whether the object has been deprecated

x_mitre_network_requirements.description: optional for attack-patterns, implies whether the network is needed for exfiltration, deprecated
